{"id": 5, "body": {"name": "Powerful Data APIs and GPT Tools for Near Developers to Easily Build", "summary": "Problem: The Near blockchain\\\\\\'s data infrastructure is underdeveloped, making it difficult for developers to access and process on-chain data. The non-EVM nature of Near adds complexity to data parsing and processing. Solution: Provide standardized, structured APIs for on-chain data on Near, enabling developers to efficiently access data. Offer an AI-powered assistant for developers to gain the necessary knowledge for building on Near.", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "linked_rfp": null, "supervisor": "trechriron71.near", "description": "## Footprint Analytics\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Primary person\\\\u{2019}s contact information\\\\nTelegram handle: @dplinnn\\\\n\\\\n### Size of the whole team\\\\nFootprint has a team of 20+ full-time developers - 10 AI and Big Data, 4 Backend, 3 Frontend, 2 Analysts, and 2 + Ops.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Team background and bios\\\\nOur core team is made up of experienced developers.\\\\n\\\\nPrior to venturing into the blockchain space, our team members have worked in reputed companies such as Goldman Sachs, JP Morgan Chase and Oracle.\\\\n\\\\nOur three co-founders have been working together for 11 years, showcasing a long-term commitment to shared goals and synergy.\\\\n\\\\nKey Team Profiles:\\\\n1. Tony Zhang - Co-founder & CEO \\\\n- A serial entrepreneur with over 20 years of experience on Wall Street \\\\n- Formerly Senior Vice President of Global Credit Trading at Bank of America in New York; Director of Credit - - Derivatives Trading at Merrill Lynch, also worked at Goldman Sachs Global, JPMorgan, and Lehman Brothers\\\\n2. Wade Deng - Co-founder & CTO \\\\n- Over a decade of tech experience\\\\n- Director of a fintech company where he built anti-fraud systems and AI models for credit score\\\\n- Led a crypto trading team, which focused on algo trading strategy on CeFi\\\\n3. Navy Tse - Co-founder & Head of Product\\\\n- Over 10 years of experience in fintech, big data, e-commerce, and mobile internet development\\\\n- Entered the blockchain technology space in 2017\\\\n- Led the team to develop several DeFi projects\\\\n- A pioneer in the open source community, contributed to the Open Source Project with over 37k stars.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Professional Experience\\\\n\\\\n**Blockchain Data Capabilities**\\\\n\\\\nFootprint Analytics has been online for over three years and has extensive expertise in the blockchain and big data space. We are capable of handling both EVM and non-EVM chains. We have successfully indexed 30+chains,including Solana and some EVM chains\\\\u{2019} trace data, demonstrating our ability to manage large volumes of data effectively. Given Near\\\\\\'s substantial historical on-chain data and the high volume of daily transactions, we are confident in our ability to handle it proficiently.\\\\n\\\\nMoreover, we are dedicated to making data more accessible and lowering the barriers to entry. We excel at abstracting and summarizing data to transform it into business-meaningful insights. Our data and APIs are designed for ease of use, covering areas such as GameFi data, token data, wallet data, and more.\\\\n\\\\n**Technical Architecture Details:**\\\\n1. Program language: Python, Javascript\\\\n2. Technical design: https://www.processon.com/view/link/632d7bd8637689341d71c50d \\\\n- Query engine: Doris, Trino\\\\n- Storage: Iceberg\\\\n- Compute engine: Trino\\\\n- Real-time: Flink + Kafka\\\\n3. Data architecture, https://files.readme.io/2ab5caf-Screenshot_2022-10-27_at_08.35.37.png \\\\n- Bronze\\\\n- Silver\\\\n- Gold\\\\n\\\\n**Non-Technical Capabilities and Resources:**\\\\n1. Research Capabilities and Resources: Research portal available for the entire community, offering metrics that matter for the ecosystem and projects all in one place. Our in-house research team collaborates with media and the community to produce market reports. We can amplify Near\\\\u{2019}s progress with dashboards and research reports. We have over 50+ media channels with 500k+ exposure.\\\\n2. Marketing Resources: Footprint has over 50k Twitter followers. To maximize exposure opportunities, projects can get featured on Footprint\\\\\\'s Twitter, participate in our Twitter Spaces, and engage in other community activities.\\\\n3. Community Support: Footprint provides dedicated analyst support to help users or projects build data dashboards and offer data tutorials.\\\\n4. AI-Powered Growth Tool: A growth tool based on the telegram and discord communities. Unlike other quests, we can provide verification of on-chain and off-chain interactions, introduce viral functions, and help projects achieve growth in key on-chain indicators.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Body\\\\n\\\\nFootprint\\\\\\'s proposal focuses on providing ready-to-use data APIs and AI-powered assistants to enable more developers to easily onboard their applications onto Near. Additionally, by increasing Near\\\\\\'s brand exposure and influence through research content, we aim to attract more developers to the Near ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\nAs a non-EVM chain, Near has a complex data structure and vast on-chain data, making it costly for ordinary projects to parse and manage this data. Footprint\\\\\\'s solution addresses this issue. We believe that stable and user-friendly APIs will significantly accelerate development and improve developer efficiency. Pre-configured research pages will allow investors, researchers, and KOLs to easily access and use data.\\\\n\\\\nBeyond data, we aim to bring a data-driven culture and transformation to Near. We will provide the community with free growth tools based on Telegram and Discord, combining on-chain and off-chain interactive community growth tools to assist in acquiring traffic. Provide data support for marketing efforts\\\\u{ff0c}such as TVL/DAU project/user rankings, Use viral tools to incentivize users to improve their leaderboard standings.\\\\n\\\\n## Goals / Milestones\\\\n\\\\nOur implementation program consists of two main parts: data API infrastructure and AI GPT creation.\\\\n**Data APIs:**\\\\nTo support developer growth, we offer a comprehensive API suite covering chain raw data, tokens, wallets, and key project indicators. Developers can access data with a single line of code, enabling rapid on-chain app development with a user-friendly experience.\\\\n**AI Assistant:**\\\\nDevelopers face numerous challenges before building on-chain, making mentorship crucial. Our Developer AI Assistant, customized for NEAR, incorporates NEAR\\\\\\'s development documentation, community guidelines, and fundamental blockchain knowledge. This trained GPT helps developers quickly access information through natural language queries, including our API interfaces and documentation. This allows developers to minimize learning time, write more efficient code, and focus on building core product functionality.\\\\n\\\\n**Milestone 1 Near chain data API**\\\\nTasks: By providing the raw data API and generating structured data tables, developers can use the data API to build any application or build a data analytics system for their project.And users can use the data on Footprint to create charts and dashboards and explore the data freely.\\\\nDeliverables:\\\\nNear chain data APIs: transactions, receipts, logs and blocks\\\\nNear chain data analytics dashboard\\\\nBatch download solution for get the all historical\\\\n  \\\\n**Milestone 2: Key indicators data API for dapps on Near **\\\\nTasks: We will collect and verify the contracts belonging to the projects on the chain, and produce reference data of the contracts of the projects on the chain, so that developers can easily find all the records of the contracts corresponding to each project. Secondly, based on the contract, we will also build key indicators data and API of the protocol, which can be used to discover the popular projects on the chain and view the performance of the projects, including DAU, TVL, transaction, volume, new user growth, etc.\\\\nDeliverables:\\\\nReference data of contracts and protocols\\\\nKey indicators of Dapp: DAU, transactions, TVL and more\\\\nKey indicators data APIs\\\\nDapp ranking dashboard\\\\n  \\\\n**Milestone 3 Token price data of tokens on Near**\\\\nTasks: Real-time 5-minute coin price data will provide the most solid and widespread support for on-chain data analytics, allowing for easy calculation of volume, balance, TVL and other metrics in USD.\\\\nDeliverables:\\\\nStructured data table: token_5min_price\\\\nToken price data API\\\\n  \\\\n**Milestone 4: Developer AI assistant for Near ecosystem**\\\\nTasks: We can customize an AI gpt assistant for Near developers, and we can add project docs, whitepapers, on-chain data, etc. to the GPT to enable it to answer development questions and provide 24/7 community service.\\\\nDeliverables:\\\\nA developer GPT assistan\\\\n   \\\\n\\\\n \\\\n## Metrics\\\\nWe will measure success based on the following deliverables and metrics:\\\\n1. The APIs will all deliveried and can be called in docs.\\\\n2. We will deliver Near\\\\\\'s data and promote Near\\\\\\'s dashboard through various channels such as articles and community engagements, aiming to achieve over 100,000 views for the Near data dashboard.\\\\n3. We will collect and maintain data on Near\\\\\\'s blockchain, ensuring that the protocols included represent over 80% of the total value locked (TVL).\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Budget\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Breakdown\\\\n\\\\nHuman resources involvement (60% of the funds)\\\\n1.1 Technical resources for data analysis and function development\\\\n1.2 Data maintenance\\\\n1.3 Community and technical support\\\\n\\\\nNode and server costs (40% of the funds)\\\\n2.1 Purchase of node services\\\\n2.2 Data storage\\\\n2.3 Computing resources according to different data tables and metrics\\\\n\\\\nWe are eager to collaborate more closely with the NEAR ecosystem and contribute positively. Looking forward to hearing feedback from the community on the proposal.\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "524f24bb0320fa84ab2ea93e589019c2c4c60a3a6a45dd0577bd6e97f40f1521", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "80000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Indexers", "Query API"]}

{"body": {"name": "Project Zero - Support for NEAR on the current and upcoming products", "summary": "Project Zero and NEAR Infrastructure committee shares the same goal of strengthening NEAR\\\\\\'s key infrastructure for the developers. Project Zero is solving A-Z problems with Blockchain Data Infrastructure ranging from core problem of data extraction to transformation, knowledge discovery with analytics focus and indexing. We believe that dApps and developers should focus on what matters i.e. building their core functionalities instead of spending time & money in dealing with blockchain data infra", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "REVIEW", "sponsor_requested_review": false, "reviewer_completed_attestation": false}, "supervisor": null, "description": "# Project Zero\\\\n\\\\n**Primary person\\\\u{2019}s contact information:**\\\\nSiddhartha Jain\\\\nHead of Product\\\\nsiddhartha@projectzero.io\\\\nTelegram: https://t.me/absolutelysid02 \\\\n\\\\n**Size of the whole team:** 12\\\\n\\\\n**Size of the engineering team:** 9\\\\n\\\\n**Team location:** Switzerland, Germany, Ukraine, Latvia, Austria\\\\n\\\\n**Team background and bios**\\\\n[Rachid Ajaja](https://www.linkedin.com/in/rachid-ajaja/) (CEO & Founder): Web3 OG, serial entrepreneur and Founder of Nexera ecosystem and several other web3 companies and products ranging from DeFi, on-chain risk intelligence and Crypto AML compliance solutions.\\\\n[Siddhartha Jain](https://www.linkedin.com/in/sidjain02/) (Head of Product): Ex- Head of Product at Lava Network and Glassnode. Overall 13+ years big tech & startup experience, previous product leader in a B2B AI based market insights platform and many other tech companies.\\\\nMark Boychuk (CTO): 13 year tech experience along with 5 years of web3 engg. experience ranging from DeFi, on-chain analytics, DEX, EVM smart contracts and other web2 experiences.\\\\nRest of the team: 7 experienced developers with work experience ranging from 5-12 years including significant web3 experiences (DeFi, DEX, Analytics, Infrastructure), 1 QA, 1 designers and a DevRel\\\\n\\\\n**Any affiliations with other NEAR ecosystem partners?:** No\\\\n\\\\n**Professional Experience**:\\\\nProject Zero began its research in 2022 to address critical issues with blockchain data extraction. Since 2022, its use-case-focused on Data extraction with data pipelines or streaming, Data Lake, Query Engine, and Indexer products have been utilized by dApps such as Nexera Exchange, Nexera ID, Nuant, evergonlabs, Wallet infrastructure Brillion and many others.\\\\n\\\\nOur goal is to streamline the blockchain data extraction process, enabling organizations to focus on problem-solving rather than the complexities of developing, managing, and maintaining services in-house or dealing with multiple vendors.\\\\n\\\\nOur mission is to empower DApps, Web3 companies, protocols, and institutions by relieving them from the burdens of infrastructure and blockchain data management. We envision a future where businesses can seamlessly focus on solving their core problems without the complexities of maintaining blockchain data operation infrastructure. We aspire to be the cornerstone solution, akin to what AWS is to cloud computing, enabling innovation and growth in the decentralized ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\nWe are solving all the blockchain data infra. problems with these products:\\\\n- Data Streaming (pipeline)\\\\n- Data transformation (edge computing as a service)\\\\n- Super indexer (multi chain, indexer on top of indexer, high availability & real-time)\\\\n- Query engine with sub-second execution to complex analytics query\\\\n- Set of Enriched APIs\\\\n- Framework for building Custom APIs\\\\n- Marketplace for several off chain & on-chain data (like price feeds)\\\\n\\\\n**Examples of relevant experience with NEAR blockchain:**\\\\nNo experience with supporting the NEAR community \\\\u{201c}yet\\\\u{201d}. We have been working with many EVM L2 blockchains closely and this proposal is to bring our solutions on NEAR blockchain where the developer community can leverage our unique solutions for the various outstanding blockchain data infrastructure problems.\\\\n\\\\n**Non-technical capabilities:**\\\\nWon web3 product of the week on Product Hunt as soon as we launched public Beta.\\\\nProven product-market-fit for several dApp use-cases as the early adopters ranges from DEX, Tokenization platform, On-chain risk intelligence, L1 for data  infra. For AI and LLMs, Wallet, DeFi trading strategy simulator.\\\\nPartnerships and listing with many blockchains along with ongoing advanced discussions. Some of them are Arbitrum, Scroll, Polygon, BitLayer, Manta Network, BVM network, Ziliqa.\\\\nSecured Grants successfully from Nexera governance/DAO for serving their entire infrastructure.\\\\nScheduled multiple marketing campaigns with leading blockchain networks like Arbitrum, Scroll, Manta, Bitlayer etc.\\\\n\\\\n**In-House Resources:**\\\\nOur entire team is in-house on full-time roles. The professional work experience is in the tech industry with multiple years in web3. Total work experience ranges from 5-13 years. \\\\nDesign, UX/UI?: Yes \\\\nProject management?: Yes \\\\nCustomer support?: Yes\\\\nBD / Marketing?: Yes, currently by the Head of Product. Plans to hire a Product Marketer\\\\n\\\\n**Portfolio of relevant work:**\\\\nStream provides seamless access to blockchain raw data both real-time and historical blockchain data. An innovative solution by pushing data to users upon availability. This approach ensures faster, more reliable, and consistent data transmission, fostering trust in the accuracy and timeliness of the data you deliver. Unlike traditional data providers like RPCs or your own node and custom solutions.It efficiently retrieves and delivers transactional data to your preferred destination like S3, Webhook, Kafka etc., ensuring uninterrupted streaming, even during chain reorganizations while maintaining data consistency and with 100% delivery guarantees.\\\\nBlock Functions enable to transform streamed data, boosting efficiency and reducing data size by retrieving exactly the data you need, when you need it. It\\\\u{2019}s edge computing as a service! Just write a JavaScript transformation function & start receiving a stream of high throughput of enriched transformed data instead of raw data. \\\\nQuery Engine (POC & V1.0) provides sub-second results to the most complex data operations and queries across a contract/address and cross-chain. It is targeted to perform analytical queries with performance of regular oltp databases.\\\\nSuper Indexers (Research & POC) stream data of the indexed protocol and beyond. Instead of depending on slow, unreliable subgraphs with a GraphQL interface making it useless when it comes to use at scale. Super Indexers is the solution to all the problems which subgraphs bring along with them.\\\\n\\\\n**Proposal:**\\\\nThis proposal aims to add support to NEAR blockchains and bring the leading innovative solution by being a bespoke blockchain data infrastructure platform to the NEAR ecosystem. Project Zero has a Data extraction and transformation (Block functions), streaming product that eliminates the burden of handling and managing chain reorgs, data inconsistency, unreliable RPCs which are impractical to use at scale, and extremely costly. Project Zero is stepping into the next phases to solve a-z blockchain data-related problems which includes products like Rich API endpoints, Query Engine and Super Indexers.\\\\n\\\\nIn the current scenario, even with the fractional existing solutions, none of them are supporting NEAR blockchain besides The Graph. The following are the benefits for the NEAR ecosystem\\\\nHuge incentive for the builders to launch on NEAR with a significantly reduce time to market dApp due to a free plug-and-play data infrastructure\\\\nNone of the so-called incumbent solutions support NEAR (Alchemy, quicknode, goldsky etc.) \\\\n\\\\nGiven the problems we are solving are very fundamental and relevant wherever on-chain data is required, NEAR developer ecosystem (dApps) can reap all the benefits by saving up to 2x time-to-market and saving their previous limited funding by eliminating the need to maintain huge infrastructure and specialized backend developers. As part of the proposal, we would like to provide 100GB/month of free usage of Streaming + Block Functions at no cost of NEAR blockchain data for 12 months from the date of approval of the proposal. Project Zero is a closed source solution with its proprietary technology and algorithms.\\\\n\\\\n**Goals / Milestones:**\\\\nAdding Near blockchains dataset from genesis: Q3 2024  \\\\nMaintaining the real-time as well as historical data: Always ongoing\\\\nImplement and provide free usage (100GB/month) of Project Zero data streaming of NEAR blockchain (Launch as soon as Task 1 is finished)\\\\nLaunch new features and products on Near: \\\\nFirst set of Rich APIs (Ex: Token API, Transaction history API etc.): End of Q3 or Start Q4 2024\\\\nMore sets of Rich APIs (always ongoing): Q4 2024 and beyond for more\\\\nData Lake and Query Engine on NEAR Blockchain: Q4\\\\\\'24\\\\nSuper Indexers v1.0 on NEAR: End of Q4\\\\\\'24 or Beginning Q1\\\\u{2019}25\\\\nSupport other types of off chain and chain data like Price feeds etc.: Q1\\\\u{2019}25\\\\n\\\\nThe timelines are subjected to the proposal approval date. We are assuming the proposal gets approved well before the end of Q3\\\\u{2019}24. For the other new products (4-6), we will try to provide some Freemium usage for the NEAR community.\\\\n\\\\n**Metrics:**\\\\nThe key success criteria or metrics are:\\\\nAdoption of Project Zero by NEAR dApps\\\\nUser retention\\\\nHigh NPS/CSAT score\\\\n\\\\n**Competitor Comparison:**\\\\nWe don\\\\u{2019}t find any 1:1 competitor who is solving all the blockchain data infrastructure problems but we view competitors at specific products level.\\\\nStreaming & Transformation - Quicknode: Project Zero has an edge with the additional type of chain reorg handling strategy, performance of chain reorg handling, higher throughput and optimized block functions. On a fast blockchain like Arbitrum, Project Zero handles more than 4 blocks per second where the existing solution isn\\\\\\'t even close to it!\\\\nSuper Indexer - The Graph (only major indexer supporting NEAR): Subgraphs on The Graph network lack usability at scale and are highly rate limited with GraphQL endpoints. Moreover the availability and freshness of real-time data isn\\\\u{2019}t common as the entire model is based on the network of operators which prefers maintaining high incentive subgraphs and blockchains. Project Zero will eliminate all these problems by providing a highly available stream of indexed data at a rapid throughput, negligible delay in real-time data update and 100% delivery guarantees.\\\\nQuery Engine and Rich APIs: There are no major platforms supporting NEAR but Project Zero differentiates with its modular architecture where adding new tables, blockchains, custom data and scaling new APIs is significantly low effort with high performance. Most of our filters by contract/address on optimized tables give subsecond performance.\\\\n\\\\n**Usage & Examples:**\\\\nProject Zero is the bespoke data infrastructure for Nexera Exchange, leveraging both historical backfills and real-time data of Ethereum and Arbitrum to their destination tools and platforms for several features. The most popular features are the [price chart](https://app.nexera.exchange/trade/ethereum/0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2/0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7/100) and [order book](https://app.nexera.exchange/trade/ethereum/0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2/0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7/100). Nexera built entire backend modules based on Project Zero data and created several services for volume, price, order status, etc.\\\\n\\\\nNexera Exchange faced several complications in extracting blockchain data at scale for something as simple as price charts on different time frames. They were dependent on several RPCs on very expensive pricing plans, which were also limited due to trace and debug calls. With Project Zero, they can stream historical data in minutes, resulting in immense performance gains, better user experience, and reduced costs. They mainly use \\\\u{2018}blocks with receipts\\\\u{2019} and \\\\u{2018}Logs\\\\u{2019} from different block numbers across multiple streams. \\\\n\\\\nBecause of Project Zero, Nexera Exchange benefits from faster chain reorg handling (4 blocks per second) on Arbitrum, which existing solutions can\\\\u{2019}t offer. We reduced recurring infrastructure costs of 15k/month to one-third of it.\\\\n\\\\nProject Zero is already empowering and soon empowering (in a few weeks from now) following blockchains Arbitrum, Bitlayer, Scroll, Manta, Polygon, Base, Optimism, Solana and Binance chain.\\\\n\\\\n**Budget Total:**\\\\n$240,000/year\\\\n\\\\n**Budget Breakdown:**\\\\nThe budget will mainly be used for scaling and maintaining infrastructure and operation costs of the products\\\\nAdding NEAR blockchain dataset from genesis\\\\nMaintaining the real-time as well as historical data\\\\nOffer free streams of 100GB/month on NEAR\\\\nBlock Functions (edge computing) for data transformation & filtering\\\\nLaunch new features and products like Rich APIs, Query Engine and Super Indexers on NEAR from initial public versions.\\\\n\\\\nWe are flexible in the recurring payment period of yearly, quarterly or monthly but with grants support for at least a year.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "projectzero.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "240000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Data Lakes", "Indexers", "Query API", "Other"]}

We envision a future where businesses can seamlessly focus on solving their core problems without the complexities of maintaining blockchain data operation infrastructure. We aspire to be the cornerstone solution, akin to what AWS is to cloud computing, enabling innovation and growth in the decentralized ecosystem.\\\\n\\\\nWe are solving all the blockchain data infra. problems with these products:\\\\n- Data Streaming (pipeline)\\\\n- Data transformation (edge computing as a service)\\\\n- Super indexer (multi chain, indexer on top of indexer, high availability & real-time)\\\\n- Query engine with sub-second execution to complex analytics query\\\\n- Set of Enriched APIs\\\\n- Framework for building Custom APIs\\\\n- Marketplace for several off chain & on-chain data (like price feeds)\\\\n\\\\n**Examples of relevant experience with NEAR blockchain:**\\\\nNo experience with supporting the NEAR community \\\\u{201c}yet\\\\u{201d}. We have been working with many EVM L2 blockchains closely and this proposal is to bring our solutions on NEAR blockchain where the developer community can leverage our unique solutions for the various outstanding blockchain data infrastructure problems.\\\\n\\\\n**Non-technical capabilities:**\\\\nWon web3 product of the week on Product Hunt as soon as we launched public Beta.\\\\nProven product-market-fit for several dApp use-cases as the early adopters ranges from DEX, Tokenization platform, On-chain risk intelligence, L1 for data  infra. For AI and LLMs, Wallet, DeFi trading strategy simulator.\\\\nPartnerships and listing with many blockchains along with ongoing advanced discussions. Some of them are Arbitrum, Scroll, Polygon, BitLayer, Manta Network, BVM network, Ziliqa.\\\\nSecured Grants successfully from Nexera governance/DAO for serving their entire infrastructure.\\\\nScheduled multiple marketing campaigns with leading blockchain networks like Arbitrum, Scroll, Manta, Bitlayer etc.\\\\n\\\\n**In-House Resources:**\\\\nOur entire team is in-house on full-time roles. The professional work experience is in the tech industry with multiple years in web3. Total work experience ranges from 5-13 years. \\\\nDesign, UX/UI?: Yes \\\\nProject management?: Yes \\\\nCustomer support?: Yes\\\\nBD / Marketing?: Yes, currently by the Head of Product. Plans to hire a Product Marketer\\\\n\\\\n**Portfolio of relevant work:**\\\\nStream provides seamless access to blockchain raw data both real-time and historical blockchain data. An innovative solution by pushing data to users upon availability. This approach ensures faster, more reliable, and consistent data transmission, fostering trust in the accuracy and timeliness of the data you deliver. Unlike traditional data providers like RPCs or your own node and custom solutions.It efficiently retrieves and delivers transactional data to your preferred destination like S3, Webhook, Kafka etc., ensuring uninterrupted streaming, even during chain reorganizations while maintaining data consistency and with 100% delivery guarantees.\\\\nBlock Functions enable to transform streamed data, boosting efficiency and reducing data size by retrieving exactly the data you need, when you need it. It\\\\u{2019}s edge computing as a service! Just write a JavaScript transformation function & start receiving a stream of high throughput of enriched transformed data instead of raw data. \\\\nQuery Engine (POC & V1.0) provides sub-second results to the most complex data operations and queries across a contract/address and cross-chain. It is targeted to perform analytical queries with performance of regular oltp databases.\\\\nSuper Indexers (Research & POC) stream data of the indexed protocol and beyond. Instead of depending on slow, unreliable subgraphs with a GraphQL interface making it useless when it comes to use at scale. Super Indexers is the solution to all the problems which subgraphs bring along with them.\\\\n\\\\n**Proposal:**\\\\nThis proposal aims to add support to NEAR blockchains and bring the leading innovative solution by being a bespoke blockchain data infrastructure platform to the NEAR ecosystem. Project Zero has a Data extraction and transformation (Block functions), streaming product that eliminates the burden of handling and managing chain reorgs, data inconsistency, unreliable RPCs which are impractical to use at scale, and extremely costly. Project Zero is stepping into the next phases to solve a-z blockchain data-related problems which includes products like Rich API endpoints, Query Engine and Super Indexers.\\\\n\\\\nIn the current scenario, even with the fractional existing solutions, none of them are supporting NEAR blockchain besides The Graph. The following are the benefits for the NEAR ecosystem\\\\nHuge incentive for the builders to launch on NEAR with a significantly reduce time to market dApp due to a free plug-and-play data infrastructure\\\\nNone of the so-called incumbent solutions support NEAR (Alchemy, quicknode, goldsky etc.) \\\\n\\\\nGiven the problems we are solving are very fundamental and relevant wherever on-chain data is required, NEAR developer ecosystem (dApps) can reap all the benefits by saving up to 2x time-to-market and saving their previous limited funding by eliminating the need to maintain huge infrastructure and specialized backend developers. As part of the proposal, we would like to provide 100GB/month of free usage of Streaming + Block Functions at no cost of NEAR blockchain data for 12 months from the date of approval of the proposal. Project Zero is a closed source solution with its proprietary technology and algorithms.\\\\n\\\\n**Goals / Milestones:**\\\\nAdding Near blockchains dataset from genesis: Q3 2024  \\\\nMaintaining the real-time as well as historical data: Always ongoing\\\\nImplement and provide free usage (100GB/month) of Project Zero data streaming of NEAR blockchain (Launch as soon as Task 1 is finished)\\\\nLaunch new features and products on Near: \\\\nFirst set of Rich APIs (Ex: Token API, Transaction history API etc.): End of Q3 or Start Q4 2024\\\\nMore sets of Rich APIs (always ongoing): Q4 2024 and beyond for more\\\\nData Lake and Query Engine on NEAR Blockchain: Q4\\\\\\'24\\\\nSuper Indexers v1.0 on NEAR: End of Q4\\\\\\'24 or Beginning Q1\\\\u{2019}25\\\\nSupport other types of off chain and chain data like Price feeds etc.: Q1\\\\u{2019}25\\\\n\\\\nThe timelines are subjected to the proposal approval date. We are assuming the proposal gets approved well before the end of Q3\\\\u{2019}24. For the other new products (4-6), we will try to provide some Freemium usage for the NEAR community.\\\\n\\\\n**Metrics:**\\\\nThe key success criteria or metrics are:\\\\nAdoption of Project Zero by NEAR dApps\\\\nUser retention\\\\nHigh NPS/CSAT score\\\\n\\\\n**Competitor Comparison:**\\\\nWe don\\\\u{2019}t find any 1:1 competitor who is solving all the blockchain data infrastructure problems but we view competitors at specific products level.\\\\nStreaming & Transformation - Quicknode: Project Zero has an edge with the additional type of chain reorg handling strategy, performance of chain reorg handling, higher throughput and optimized block functions. On a fast blockchain like Arbitrum, Project Zero handles more than 4 blocks per second where the existing solution isn\\\\\\'t even close to it!\\\\nSuper Indexer - The Graph (only major indexer supporting NEAR): Subgraphs on The Graph network lack usability at scale and are highly rate limited with GraphQL endpoints. Moreover the availability and freshness of real-time data isn\\\\u{2019}t common as the entire model is based on the network of operators which prefers maintaining high incentive subgraphs and blockchains. Project Zero will eliminate all these problems by providing a highly available stream of indexed data at a rapid throughput, negligible delay in real-time data update and 100% delivery guarantees.\\\\nQuery Engine and Rich APIs: There are no major platforms supporting NEAR but Project Zero differentiates with its modular architecture where adding new tables, blockchains, custom data and scaling new APIs is significantly low effort with high performance. Most of our filters by contract/address on optimized tables give subsecond performance.\\\\n\\\\n**Usage & Examples:**\\\\nProject Zero is the bespoke data infrastructure for Nexera Exchange, leveraging both historical backfills and real-time data of Ethereum and Arbitrum to their destination tools and platforms for several features. The most popular features are the [price chart](https://app.nexera.exchange/trade/ethereum/0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2/0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7/100) and [order book](https://app.nexera.exchange/trade/ethereum/0xc02aaa39b223fe8d0a0e5c4f27ead9083c756cc2/0xdac17f958d2ee523a2206206994597c13d831ec7/100). Nexera built entire backend modules based on Project Zero data and created several services for volume, price, order status, etc.\\\\n\\\\nNexera Exchange faced several complications in extracting blockchain data at scale for something as simple as price charts on different time frames. They were dependent on several RPCs on very expensive pricing plans, which were also limited due to trace and debug calls. With Project Zero, they can stream historical data in minutes, resulting in immense performance gains, better user experience, and reduced costs. They mainly use \\\\u{2018}blocks with receipts\\\\u{2019} and \\\\u{2018}Logs\\\\u{2019} from different block numbers across multiple streams. \\\\n\\\\nBecause of Project Zero, Nexera Exchange benefits from faster chain reorg handling (4 blocks per second) on Arbitrum, which existing solutions can\\\\u{2019}t offer. We reduced recurring infrastructure costs of 15k/month to one-third of it.\\\\n\\\\nProject Zero is already empowering and soon empowering (in a few weeks from now) following blockchains Arbitrum, Bitlayer, Scroll, Manta, Polygon, Base, Optimism, Solana and Binance chain.\\\\n\\\\n**Budget Total:**\\\\n$240,000/year\\\\n\\\\n**Budget Breakdown:**\\\\nThe budget will mainly be used for scaling and maintaining infrastructure and operation costs of the products\\\\nAdding NEAR blockchain dataset from genesis\\\\nMaintaining the real-time as well as historical data\\\\nOffer free streams of 100GB/month on NEAR\\\\nBlock Functions (edge computing) for data transformation & filtering\\\\nLaunch new features and products like Rich APIs, Query Engine and Super Indexers on NEAR from initial public versions.\\\\n\\\\nWe are flexible in the recurring payment period of yearly, quarterly or monthly but with grants support for at least a year.", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "projectzero.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "240000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Other", "Indexers", "Query API", "Data Lakes"]}

{"body": {"name": "to support the operation of the Bridge Aggregator", "summary": "The primary approach of this proposal is to connect more Layer 1 and EVM Layer 2 liquidity to the NEAR Protocol. In just the first week of serving the NEAR Protocol ecosystem, since August 5th, 2024, this strategy has proven effective, with $36K worth of $USDC assets being bridged into NEAR Protocol through the EVM chain. These assets have been actively utilised in on-chain activities such as farming on Ref Finance or being supplied as collateral in Burrow Finance.", "category": "Infrastructure Committee", "timeline": {"status": "DRAFT"}, "description": "## Organisation\\\\nRef Finance\\\\n\\\\n## Primary person\\\\u{2019}s contact information\\\\nAescobar Michael / Aescobar7359 (tg) \\\\n\\\\n## Size of the Whole Team\\\\n15\\\\n\\\\n## Size of the Engineering Team \\\\n8\\\\n\\\\n## Team Location\\\\nChina & South East Asia \\\\n\\\\n## Team background and bios\\\\nTeam is also the main team who run the biggest DEX on NEAR Protocol and biggest money market in NEAR Burrow Finance, also building Satoshi Bridge utilising Chain Signature.\\\\n\\\\n## Any affiliations with other NEAR ecosystem partners?\\\\nPartnered up with most of the projects in the ecosystem whether they have a token or not. \\\\n\\\\n## Professional Experience\\\\nRunning the Ref Finance as DEX since 2021 and continuing till now, also building more infrastructure for the NEAR Protocol Ecosystem as a whole \\\\n\\\\n## Examples of relevant experience with NEAR blockchain\\\\nhttps://app.ref.finance/\\\\nhttps://app.burrow.finance/ \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Non-technical capabilities\\\\nThe Ref team has extensive experience in building a DEX, supported by our marketing and business development strategies, which have generated $7.3 billion in total trade volume since we launched on mainnet.\\\\n\\\\n## In-House Resources\\\\nAll of the team member is InHouse Resources, including designer, project manager, BD and Marketing \\\\nDesigner: @Audrey9215\\\\nBD: @Aescobar7359\\\\nPM: @zerochlwork\\\\nMarketing: @anmai\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Portfolio of Relevant Work \\\\nhttps://dappradar.com/dapp/ref-finance \\\\nhttps://dappradar.com/dapp/burrow\\\\n\\\\n## Body\\\\n- The primary approach and solution of the proposal\\\\nThe primary approach of this proposal is to connect more Layer 1 and EVM Layer 2 liquidity to the NEAR Protocol. In just the first week of serving the NEAR Protocol ecosystem, since August 5th, 2024, this strategy has proven effective, with $36K worth of $USDC assets being bridged into NEAR Protocol through the EVM chain. These assets have been actively utilised in on-chain activities such as farming on Ref Finance or being supplied as collateral in Burrow Finance.\\\\n\\\\n- Why should the committee choose this project?\\\\nSince its mainnet launch, Ref Finance has been dedicated to supporting the NEAR Protocol ecosystem. As the first DEX on NEAR, Ref Finance has been at the forefront of this ecosystem\\\\\\'s growth.\\\\n\\\\n- Will this solution be open source? What licensing are you releasing under?\\\\nSolution and SmartContract will be open source, but we hope NF can cover the audit cost.\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Goals / Milestones\\\\n- Bring more liquidity to NEAR Protocol \\\\n- Bring in at least minimum 250K worth of $USDC in the first 1 month\\\\n- More assets option and more token on NEAR with the support of Ref\\\\u{2019}s BD \\\\n\\\\nBe sure to communicate what the finished effort looks like \\\\n- Majority chain connected to NEAR Protocol through this approach \\\\n- More assets been supported to be bridge in and it increase NEAR liquidity in general \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n\\\\nShould include a timeline with milestones, including what will be delivered for each\\\\n- Aug 20, 2024 Integrated 10 chain supported by Stargate \\\\n- Sep 20, 2024 Integrate MesonFi, which give us more option of assets like USDT, ETH and synthetic BTC \\\\n- 27 Sept 2024 Integrate XLINK to bring more synthetic BTC and connect to more chain like BTC L2 and bring more synthetic btc \\\\n- Oct 11, 2024 Integrate Rainbow to bring FRAX directly from ETH to NEAR Protocol\\\\n- Oct 25, 2024 Integrate Wormhole to bridge in Solana\\\\u{2019}s assets like meme and more \\\\n\\\\n## Metrics\\\\n- Growth of user number in DeFi Ecosystem \\\\n- Liquidity growth on NEAR DeFi Ecosystem\\\\n- 3-5 Million USD worth of assets bridged into NEAR through any other chain\\\\n\\\\nMetrics and measurements that prove your solution was implemented\\\\n- Increase ecosystem on chain trading volume through Ref Finance and Delta Trade which the volume will back contribute to Ref Finance \\\\n- Increase ecosystem liquidity through stable assets \\\\n- More new users who focus on DeFi liquidity use case\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Usage & Examples\\\\n\\\\nWho is currently using your solution? Other ecosystems?\\\\nThe target users of the bridge aggregator are those in the EVM or other ecosystems who are interested in the NEAR Protocol DeFi ecosystem but prefer not to interact with centralised exchanges (CEX). Many users want their liquidity to remain on-chain. With the bridge aggregator, they can easily bridge assets to NEAR Protocol with just one click, using only their NEAR wallet.\\\\n\\\\nCan you share some metrics relevant to your proposal?\\\\nTotal assets bridged over to NEAR through the Bridge Aggregator are handled seamlessly, abstracting the Aurora layer so users don\\\\u{2019}t need to worry about taking additional actions on the Aurora side.\\\\n\\\\nLink to Contract: \\\\nhttps://explorer.mainnet.aurora.dev/address/0x04dFb979Ffa1Fb08B6e6EF626377161CBB085Cf1?tab=token_transfers \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Budget Total \\\\n50K USD worth of $USDC or $NEAR \\\\n\\\\n## Budget Breakdown \\\\n- 10K USD incentive to back end dev focus on integration \\\\n- 10K USD incentive to front end dev to adjust design and build more detail to give better user experience on tracking and developing \\\\n- 10K USD incentive for smart contract Dev\\\\n- 20K USD applied to Marketing and Business Development by incentivizing users who bridge in and do on chain defi activity, especially new wallet \\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "ref-dev-teller.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "50000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "USDC"}, "labels": ["Bridges"]}

What licensing are you releasing under?\\\\nThis Oracle is belong to Pyth Network and will run by Pyth it self \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Goals / Milestones\\\\n\\\\n- More DApps want to build on top of NEAR when they know there is infra they can utilise without cutting their own cost \\\\n- Easier for the Project owner to develop their plan on NEAR without searching for extra service\\\\n- More assets come to Burrow Finance especially when they know the price feed has been supported through the Oracle \\\\n- Integrate more synthetic BTC assets \\\\n- Integrate more BTC assets that utilise Oracle on Burrow Finance\\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Grant Timeline \\\\nGrant will cover September to December Pyth Oracle Fee\\\\n## Metrics\\\\n- Measure success by increasing the influx of assets into the NEAR Protocol, enhancing its options for trading and participation in the lending and borrowing ecosystem.\\\\n- Measurement of this implemented is the accurate price feed for each assets operating under DeFi protocol in NEAR like delta trade DCA also Ref Finance Degen Pool \\\\n\\\\n\\\\n## Usage & Examples\\\\n- Burrow Finance will use this as assets price feed \\\\n- Nearlend will use this as assets price feed \\\\n- Ref Finance will utilise Pyth for Degen Pool price feed accuracy to provide fast and accurate swap with good output \\\\n- Delta Trade utilise this for DCA vault \\\\n\\\\n## Budget Total\\\\n4K $NEAR for 4 Months September to December\\\\n\\\\n### Budget Breakdown\\\\nSeptember: 1K $NEAR to pay Pyth Oracle service\\\\nOctober: 1K $NEAR to pay Pyth Oracle service\\\\nNovember: 1K $NEAR to pay Pyth Oracle service\\\\nDecember: 1K $NEAR to pay Pyth Oracle service\\\\n", "linked_proposals": [], "receiver_account": "ref-dev-teller.near", "requested_sponsor": "infrastructure-committee.near", "proposal_body_version": "V1", "requested_sponsorship_usd_amount": "4000", "requested_sponsorship_paid_in_currency": "NEAR"}, "labels": ["Oracles"]}
